article_title: GOP Senate candidates mostly bash Begich, Obama and EPA in Fairbanks forum
article_text: With less than two weeks to go before the primary election, the GOP contenders continue to expend much of their energy going after incumbent Democratic U.S. Sen. Mark Begich and the federal government. Their complaints about one another have increased somewhat recently, but the candidates save their harshest attacks for political ads and other situations where they do not share a stage. They took jabs at each other Wednesday but kept it polite for most of the 90-minute session.
